title: Triangle Bound
texString: If $a,b,c$ are three sides of a triangle, and $a+b+c=2$, then prove that $a^2+b^2+c^2+2abc<2$

title: Polynomials in Balance
texString: Let $P$ be a polynomial with positive real coefficients. Prove that if $P(1/x) \geq 1/P(x)$ holds for $x=1$, then it holds for all $x>0$

title: Generalized Symmetry
texString: Let $a,b,c$ be positive real numbers. Prove that $\frac{a^3}{b}+\frac{b^3}{c}+\frac{c^3}{a} \geq a^2+b^2+c^2$.

title: Nested Sums
texString: Let $a_1,a_2,\ldots a_n$ be positive real numbers that verify $a_1a_2 \cdots a_n=1$. Show that

title: Cyclic Triplets
texString: Consider a round-robin tournament with $2k + 1$ teams, where each team plays each other team exactly once. We say that three teams $X, Y$ and $Z$, form a cyclic triplet if $X$ beats $Y$, $Y$ beats $Z$ and $Z$ beats $X$. There are no ties. Find the minimum and maximum possible number of cyclic triplets.

title: Binary Identities
texString: Consider a set $S$ and a binary operation $*$, i.e., for each $a,b \in S$, $a*b \in S$. Assume $(a*b)*a = b$ for all $a,b \in S$. Prove that $a * (b * a) = b$ for all $a,b \in S$.

title: Prime Pairs
texString: Find all pairs of prime numbers $(p,q)$ such that $p^2+1=q^5$

title: GCD Patterns
texString: The numbers in the sequence $101, 104, 109,116, . . .$ are of the form $a_n = 100+n^2$, where $n = 1,2,3,\ldots$ For each $n$, let $d_n$ be the greatest common divisor of $a_n$ and $a_{n+1}$. Find the maximum value of $d_n$ as $n$ ranges through the positive integers.

title: Perfect Squares
texString: Let $n,p>1$ be positive integers and $p$ be prime. Given that $n \mid p-1$ and $p \mid n^3-1$, prove that $4n-3$ is a perfect square.

title: Binomial Divisibility
texString: is an integer for all pairs of integers $n \geq m \geq 1$

title: Power GCDs
texString: Prove that if $m,n \in Z^+: m \neq n$, then

title: Divisible Polynomials
texString: Find all polynomials $W$ with integer coefficients satisfying the following condition: for every natural number $n$, $2^n-1$ is divisible by $W(n)$

title: Rationality Test
texString: Let $a,b$ be real numbers such that $a^2+b^2$, $a^3+b^3$ and $a^4+b^4$ are rational numbers. Show that $a+b$ and $ab$ are also rational numbers.

title: Prime Factorization Growth
texString: Prove that for every nonnegative integer $n$, the number $7^{7^n}+1$ is the product of at least $2n + 3$ (not necessarily distinct) primes.
